moves.6... bxc6: That costs a pawn. Black had to play Bxc6
moves.9. O-O: The bishop can be taken always, because after a move like Be6 falls pawn c6
moves.9... Bd6 10. Nxd7 Qxd7 11. f4: Goes for attack. Be3 was an alternative
moves.11... Bc5+ 12. Kh1 Qxd1 13. Rxd1 O-O: Better was the very strong Ng4!
moves.14... Bb4 15. e5 Bxc3 16. bxc3 Nd5: Black's pawn structure isn't better, but white has a bishop and black a knight.
moves.17. c4 Nc3: now the knight goes to the side. Better was calmly Nb6
moves.18. Rd3 Na4 19. Ba3: Strong move to bring rook a1 to d1
moves.20... Rxd3 21. Rxd3: cxd3 is too passive and causes a few holes. A good side is that it heals the pawn structure.
moves.21... Nb6 22. Bc1: Reactivating the bishop. On Nxc4 follows Rc3 Na5 Bd2
moves.23... Rb8 24. Kf2: Let black think c4 can be taken
moves.24... Nxc4 25. Rc3 Rb4 26. a3 Ra4 27. Ke: Brings the king and then the pawn will fall
moves.27... Nb6: black goes already back, to prevent worse

opening: Ruy Lopez (C62), old Steinitz defence, Nimzovich attack
